body.name: Organic Baby Diaper Rash Relief Balm by Irene Organics - Diaper Rash Treatment Made with Natural Ingredients for Soothing and Relief, Essentials for Baby’s Bum 4oz
body.stockDetail: Only 8 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 40 mins
features: PROVIDES DIAPER RASH RELIEF AND PREVENTION - Our diaper balm is formulated to help relieve diaper rash and redness in a natural way! Gentle enough to use daily to help prevent any future diaper rashes or even be used as a daily moisturizer.

ALL NATURAL & ORGANIC INGREDIENTS - Our organic diaper balm contains Grapeseed Oil, Shea Butter, Coconut Oil, Zinc Oxide and Lavender Essential Oil, known for their nourishing and protective skin properties. Free from petroleum, mineral oil, artificial fragrances, preservatives, and toxins, making it safe for your baby's delicate skin.
DIAPER BAG ESSENTIAL - Throw it in your diaper bag or keep it in your diaper caddy to use daily as a diaper rash preventative!

ECO-FRIENDLY & USA HANDMADE - Made with love in small batches and packaged in a a glass amber jar to also avoid the need for any preservatives and avoid chemicals from plastics that may seep into your balm. Plus, we care about the environment!

PARENT & BABY AWARD WINNER 2022 - Irene Organics is a women-owned small business that won Best Baby Skincare Brand in the Northeast, USA. When you support Irene Organics, not only are you making the cleanest, most natural choice for you and your baby, but you are also supporting a mom-owned business and helping Irene spread the message that natural, toxin-free, preservative-free products is what every parent and child deserve!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Voted Best Postpartum & Baby Skincare Company in 2022! Hand-crafted mommy and baby skincare with all natural and organic ingredients that are effective.

Irene Organics Baby Skincare Line - NEW! Baby Oatmeal Bath Treatment Powder A gentle powder that can be used in a warm bath to help soothe and relieve eczema, dry skin, sunburns, rashes or minor skin irritations. Ingredients: Colloidal Oatmeal Powder, Marshmallow Root Powder, Calendula Powder, Chamomile Powder Baby Oil (4 fl oz) A gentle, lightweight, fast absorbing oil with just 3 ingredients that hydrates your baby's skin without leaving them feeling greasy or sticky. Also gentle enough to be used on cradle cap. Ingredients: Grapeseed Oil, Jojoba Oil, Calendula Oil Diaper Rash Relief Balm (4 oz) Formulated with natural ingredients to help relieve diaper rash and prevent diaper rash in a simple way. Ingredients: Grapeseed Oil, Coconut Oil, Shea Butter, Beeswax, Zinc Oxide, Calendula Oil, Lavender Essential Oil Baby Balm (4oz) Formulated with natural ingredients to help hydrate and relieve dry skin and itchiness. Ingredients: Grapeseed Oil, Coconut Oil, Shea Butter, Beeswax, Calendula Oil, Lavender Essential Oil, Chamomile Essential Oil

Made with natural, rich ingredients Grapeseed Oil Formulated with natural oils that are high in Vitamin E and essential fatty omega acids to increase elasticity, moisturize, hydrate and absorb quickly into the skin leaving it supple and silky smooth. Chamomile Extract Chamomile oil can help calm skin inflammation and redness, making it a useful natural remedy for conditions, such as acne, dry skin and eczema. Calendula Extract Calendula oil has properties that make it useful in healing wounds, soothing eczema, and relieving itching associated with dry skin, eczema and rashes.

Irene Organics Backstory How Irene Organics was Created? Irene has never considered how the products everyone takes for granted aren't as clean as we think until her mother was diagnosed with breast cancer at just 28 years old. With environmental factors as the cause, she started to educate herself on the foods that we eat and the everyday products that we use that can affect our health. It was a path down a very long road that would lead her to found Irene Organics some years later. "Before starting Irene Organics Skincare I was a professional nanny for over 10 years and then later became a Certified Pediatric Sleep Consultant so I had a lot of experience working with parents and babies. I also had a passion for making my own natural, homemade skincare products and realized that the children I cared for responded well to my natural DIY products in comparison to larger store brand products" - Irene 2020 saw Irene expecting her first child, and with this detailed knowledge of the industry behind her, she wanted to create a product that would be entirely safe for her, and for other moms to use. "That's when I created my Pregnancy & Postpartum Mama line, to help mothers like me keep their skin feeling and looking good in a natural way without any harm to them or their little ones. In 2021 my son was born and I knew I needed to get working on my Baby Skincare line as well." Irene explained. In 2022 Irene Organics won the Parent & Baby Award for Best Postpartum & Baby Skincare Brand in the Northeast - USA. Now, in 2023 Irene is also expecting her second son. When you support Irene Organics, not only are you making the cleanest, most natural choice for you and your baby, but you are also supporting a small women-owned, mom-owned business and helping Irene spread the message that natural, toxin-free, preservative-free products is what every parent and child deserve.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I can't say enough about the quality of the Irene Organics products. I absolutely love and appreciate the simple and clean ingredients. I'm so sick of other so-called "natural" brands that will include chemicals such as Polysorbate 60 among others and still push their products as natural and market them as being organic. I've come to realize that "made with" certified organic ingredients means nothing but a marketing ploy. The Irene Organics products are so simple and high quality and I love them. I have their belly oil, belly balm, baby eczema cream, and now this baby diaper rash relief balm.This diaper rash balm is so gentle and practically unscented, and it has a very nice texture that is substantial but not pasty like most conventional diaper creams.If you're looking for the truly organic and simple/clean products for you and your baby, these products are it. While the baby products are Vine purchased items, my belly oil and balms were not and I purchased those before I even became a Vine member.These items are so worth the price and because they are NOT diluted with filler ingredients and preservatives, they last a lot longer and are more effective. I've had my belly oil and balm since the beginning of my pregnancy and I'm almost 32 weeks now. I still have a good bit in my bottle and jar. I'm all for paying a little more up front to get a high quality item that will last me a lot longer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I think it worked okay
reviews.reviewText: We use this as more of a preventative, than to treat an actual diaper rash. I would put iWe use this as more of a preventative, than to treat an actual diaper rash. I would put it on my sons bottom before sending him to daycare when he was still wearing diapers. I think it helped to avoid irritation for when he did not have his diaper changed right away. It’s very greasy but the glass jar is really nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice balm
reviews.reviewText: This is a great addition to my rash arsenal. I keep quite an assortment due to 2 in diapers and a kiddo with eczema.This balm is really nice. It spreads easily, is not overly scented with lavender as I have experienced with other stuff for kids that has lavender.When it arrived we were ina diaper rash battle with my 3.5 month old. Raw, red and really hard to heal diaper rash that was headed to the dr next for a prescription. Now, please don't misunderstand, I am definitely not claiming this is good in place of a prescription when that is needed. I had tried all my tried and true methods (5 kids worth of collected diaper rash battle knowledge) and nothing was really working. We slathered this balm on each diaper change and continued our airing out routine and it healed up quickly. It was noticeably different within 3 days. It was wonderful.Product comes in nice jar and is definitely something great for a baby registry/shower gift.We will be buying more and also trying their excema balm too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: My son would often get baby rashs because of his sensative skin. We tried desitin but that didnt seem to work much. I seen this baby rash cream and was immediately surprised at how well it worked. My son immediately felt relieved and within two times of using this cream, his diaper rash was gone. Yes it is pretty pricey but it actual works and brings relief to our babies. In my opinion, it is worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I have tried diaper rash cream that smelled like rotten fish before, but this is NOT it! This is a nice natural and organic diaper cream with a pleasant smell - coconutty. It feels good on the skin. Its a little pricey but I like that this is organic - especially since my kids have a history with eczema and other skin sensitivities, and I like supporting small business. This came with a sweet little thank you card and everything.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Handy to Have
reviews.reviewText: When the babies visit, often times their parents will ask if we have certain products on hand that they need during their visits. And, they prefer the natural products. I'm finally gathering some quality, healthy products to keep on hand and I know they'll love this. It smells so nice with a light scent of lavender.In fact, we had to use this last night when the five-year-old was scratching his legs due to eczema. It soothed him enough so he could fall asleep. I'm sure it will come in handy for all sorts of rashes and dryness issues, for the kids as well as the adults.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for sensitive bottoms
reviews.reviewText: My son has a very sensitive bottom and it always gets bright red , I’ve applied this with every diaper change and has absolutely helped . It acts as a barrier for the pre and poo also . It came in a cute personalized packaging and I love that it came in a nice sturdy glass bottle . Sadly as much as I use it it’s already almost gone after a few weeks . Definitely worth the money and I’ll be investing in some more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great diaper balm!
reviews.reviewText: I love this diaper balm. I love that it is made with natural oils instead of other crap that you can't pronounce. We haven't had diaper rash to treat with it yet, but it has been great at preventing! I usually use it at night for an added layer of protection.
